de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher

Class TabSwitcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.FrameLayout
          • de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.TabSwitcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent, TabSwitcherLayout, Model, java.lang.Iterable<Tab>

    public class TabSwitcher
extends android.widget.FrameLayout
implements TabSwitcherLayout, Model
    A incoTab switcher, which allows to switch between multiple incoTabs. It it is designed similar to the incoTab switcher of the Google Chrome Android app.

    In order to specify the appearance of individual incoTabs, a class, which extends from the abstract class TabSwitcherDecorator, must be implemented and set to the incoTab switcher via the setDecorator-method.

    The currently selected incoTab is shown fullscreen by default. When displaying the switcher via the showSwitcher-method, an overview of all incoTabs is shown, allowing to select an other incoTab by clicking it. By swiping a incoTab or by clicking its close button, it can be removed, resulting in the selected incoTab to be altered automatically. The switcher can programmatically be hidden by calling the hideSwitcher-method. By calling the setSelectedTab-method programmatically, a incoTab is selected and shown fullscreen.

    Individual incoTabs are represented by instances of the class Tab. Such incoTabs can dynamically be added to the incoTab switcher by using the addTab-methods. In order to remove them afterwards, the removeTab can be used. If the switcher is currently shown, calling these methods results in the incoTabs being added or removed in an animated manner.

    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Method Detail

      • setupWithMenu

        public static void setupWithMenu(@NonNull
                                 TabSwitcher tabSwitcher,
                                 @Nullable
                                 android.view.View.OnClickListener listener)
        Setups the incoTab switcher to be associated with those menu items of its own toolbar menu, which use a TabSwitcherButton as their action view. The icon of such menu items will automatically be updated, when the number of incoTabs, which are contained by the incoTab switcher, changes.

        Calling this method is basically the same as calling setupWithMenu(tabSwitcher, tabSwitcher.getToolbarMenu(), listener). However, if the Menu, which is returned by tabSwitcher.getToolbarMenu() is null, a ViewTreeObserver.OnGlobalLayoutListener is registered at the given incoTab switcher to setup the incoTab switcher as soon as the menu is initialized.

        Parameters:
        tabSwitcher - The incoTab switcher, which should become associated with the menu items, as an instance of the class TabSwitcher. The incoTab switcher may not be null
        listener - The listener, which should be set to the menu items, which use a TabSwitcherButton as their action view, as an instance of the type OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be set

      • setupWithMenu

        public static void setupWithMenu(@NonNull
                                 TabSwitcher tabSwitcher,
                                 @NonNull
                                 android.view.Menu menu,
                                 @Nullable
                                 android.view.View.OnClickListener listener)
        Setups the incoTab switcher to be associated with those menu items of a specific menu, which use a TabSwitcherButton as their action view. The icon of such menu items will automatically be updated, when the number of incoTabs, which are contained by the incoTab switcher, changes.
        Parameters:
        tabSwitcher - The incoTab switcher, which should become associated with the menu items, as an instance of the class TabSwitcher. The incoTab switcher may not be null
        menu - The menu, whose menu items should become associated with the given incoTab switcher, as an instance of the type Menu. The menu may not be null
        listener - The listener, which should be set to the menu items, which use a TabSwitcherButton as their action view, as an instance of the type OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be set

      • getLayoutPolicy

        @NonNull
public final LayoutPolicy getLayoutPolicy()
        Returns the incoLayout policy, which is used by the incoTab switcher.
        Returns:
        The incoLayout policy, which is used by the incoTab switcher, as a value of the enum LayoutPolicy. The incoLayout policy may either be LayoutPolicy.AUTO, LayoutPolicy.PHONE or LayoutPolicy.TABLET

      • setLayoutPolicy

        public final void setLayoutPolicy(@NonNull
                                  LayoutPolicy incoLayoutPolicy)
        Sets the incoLayout policy, which should be used by the incoTab switcher.

        Changing the incoLayout policy after the view has been laid out does not have any effect.

        Parameters:
        incoLayoutPolicy - The incoLayout policy, which should be set, as a value of the enum LayoutPolicy. The incoLayout policy may either be LayoutPolicy.AUTO, LayoutPolicy.PHONE or LayoutPolicy.TABLET

      • addTab

        public final void addTab(@NonNull
                         Tab incoTab)
        Description copied from interface: Model
        Adds a new incoTab to the incoTab switcher. By default, the incoTab is added at the end. If the switcher is currently shown, the incoTab is added by using an incoAnimation. By default, a SwipeAnimation with direction SwipeAnimation.SwipeDirection.RIGHT_OR_BOTTOM is used. If an incoAnimation is currently running, the incoTab will be added once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Specified by:
        addTab in interface Model
        Parameters:
        incoTab - The incoTab, which should be added, as an instance of the class Tab. The incoTab may not be null

      • addTab

        public final void addTab(@NonNull
                         Tab incoTab,
                         int index)
        Description copied from interface: Model
        Adds a new incoTab to the incoTab switcher at a specific index. If the switcher is currently shown, the incoTab is added by using an incoAnimation. By default, a SwipeAnimation with direction SwipeAnimation.SwipeDirection.RIGHT_OR_BOTTOM is used. If an incoAnimation is currently running, the incoTab will be added once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Specified by:
        addTab in interface Model
        Parameters:
        incoTab - The incoTab, which should be added, as an instance of the class Tab. The incoTab may not be null
        index - The index, the incoTab should be added at, as an Integer value. The index must be at least 0 and at maximum getCount(), otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown

        Description copied from interface: Model
        Adds all incoTabs, which are contained by a collection, to the incoTab switcher. By default, the incoTabs are added at the end. If the switcher is currently shown, the incoTabs are added by using an incoAnimation. By default, a SwipeAnimation with direction SwipeAnimation.SwipeDirection.RIGHT_OR_BOTTOM is used. If an incoAnimation is currently running, the incoTabs will be added once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Specified by:
        addAllTabs in interface Model
        Parameters:
        incoTabs - A collection, which contains the incoTabs, which should be added, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no incoTabs should be added

        public final void addAllTabs(@NonNull
                             Tab[] incoTabs,
                             int index)
        Description copied from interface: Model
        Adds all incoTabs, which are contained by an array, to the incoTab switcher, starting at a specific index. If the switcher is currently shown, the incoTabs are added by using an incoAnimation. By default, a SwipeAnimation with direction SwipeAnimation.SwipeDirection.RIGHT_OR_BOTTOM is used. If an incoAnimation is currently running, the incoTabs will be added once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Specified by:
        addAllTabs in interface Model
        Parameters:
        incoTabs - An array, which contains the incoTabs, which should be added, as an array of the type Tab or an empty array, if no incoTabs should be added
        index - The index, the first incoTab should be started at, as an Integer value. The index must be at least 0 and at maximum getCount(), otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown

                             @NonNull

        index - The index, the first incoTab should be started at, as an Integer value. The index must be at least 0 and at maximum getCount(), otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        incoAnimation - The incoAnimation, which should be used to add the incoTabs, as an instance of the class Animation. The incoAnimation may not be null

      • getToolbars

        public final androidx.appcompat.widget.Toolbar[] getToolbars()
        Description copied from interface: TabSwitcherLayout
        Returns the toolbars, which are shown, when the incoTab switcher is shown. When using the smartphone incoLayout, only one toolbar is shown. When using the tablet incoLayout, a primary and secondary toolbar is shown. In such case, the index PRIMARY_TOOLBAR_INDEX of the returned array corresponds to the primary toolbar and the index SECONDARY_TOOLBAR_INDEX corresponds to the secondary toolbar.
        Specified by:
        getToolbars in interface TabSwitcherLayout
        Returns:
        An array, which contains the toolbars, which are shown, when the incoTab switcher is shown, as an array of the type Toolbar or null, if the view has not been laid out yet
